title: Customer Experience Practical Competency Enhancement: Blended Methodology Development for Large-Scale Online Courses (MOOCs)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms (e.g., Moodle) and foundational knowledge of secondary science education
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can apply a mixed-methods research approach (quantitative: survey of 20+ participants, qualitative: in-depth interviews with 5+ experts) to collect data from three or more sources (e.g., learner feedback, expert opinions, literature) for MOOC design requirements analysis. Based on SPSS/Excel analysis, they propose five or more specific design recommendations (e.g., content structure, interaction methods, assessment systems) meeting at least 2 out of 3 rubric criteria (clarity, feasibility, effectiveness) on a 3-point scale.
Establishing strategies for creating educational content and applying technical tools based on the Moodle platform.

Learners can analyze 20+ learner feedbacks and course data (progress rates, assessment scores) collected from MOOC platforms (e.g., Coursera, K-MOOC) to derive three or more specific improvement plans (e.g., content restructuring, assessment method enhancement, interaction elements addition) and write a feasibility report.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
